intro: Hemitelia rufescens, commonly known as the red-stemmed hemitelia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, reddish stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped with a slightly hairy surface. Hemitelia rufescens is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and shrublands.
